intro: Wurmbea marginata, commonly known as the white lily of the Nile, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has strap-like, grassy leaves. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Wurmbea marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
